Luca Limongelli 2013-08-20 2290 Regional Fishery Bodies (RFB) - Fact Sheets 6426 Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) (+39) 06 57051 (+39) 06 570 53152 FAO-HQ@fao.org http://www.fao.org 310 Regional Fishery Bodies summary descriptions Descriptions succinctes des Organismes R\ufffd\ufffdgionaux des P\ufffd\ufffdches Descripci\ufffd\ufffdnes resumidas de los \ufffd\ufffdrganos Regionales de la Pesca Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO-UN) Fishery Governance Fact Sheets FAO 2013-08-20 2013-08-20 270 270 Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Environment Programme (PERSGA) Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Environment Programme (PERSGA) Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Environment Programme (PERSGA) Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Environment Programme (PERSGA) Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Environment Programme (PERSGA) Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Environment Programme (PERSGA) Regional Organization for the Conservation of the Environment of the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden (PERSGA) The Regional Organization for the Conservation of the Environment of the Red Sea & Gulf of Aden (PERSGA) aims at the rational use of living and non-living marine and coastal resources, in a manner ensuring optimum benefit for the present generation, while maintaining the potential of that environment to satisfy the needs and aspirations of future generations.

While PERSGA is primarily concerned with the protection of the marine and coastal environment, it has taken steps towards the establishment of a regional commission for fisheries in its area of competence.

]]> The Red Sea, the Gulf of Aqaba, the Gulf of Suez, the Suez Canal to its end on the Mediterranean, and the Gulf of Aden as bounded by the following rhumb lines:

From Ras Dharbat Ali (lat. 16\ufffd\ufffd39\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd N, long. 53\ufffd\ufffd03.5\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd E), thence to a point (lat. 16\ufffd\ufffd00\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd N, long. 53\ufffd\ufffd25\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd E), thence to a point (lat. 12\ufffd\ufffd40\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd N, long. 55\ufffd\ufffd00\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd E) lying E.N.E. of Socotra Island, thence to Ras Hafun (lat. 10\ufffd\ufffd26\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd N, long. 51\ufffd\ufffd25\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd E).
